problem_text: If L K = 4, M P = 3, P Q = 6, K J = 2, R S = 6, and L P = 2, find J H.
proof:
Step 1:
Theorem: Known facts
Premises : start
Conclusions: KQ, K on JL, L on JM, 3 = MP, HS || KQ, P on MQ, 6 = RS, L on KM, HS || JR, MQ, JR || KQ, 6 = PQ, J on HM, 4 = KL, R on MS, HS || LP, 2 = JK, JR || LP, KM, 2 = LP, KQ || LP

Step 2:
Theorem: Line Segment Split
Premises : K on JL
Conclusions: JL = JK + KL

Step 3:
Theorem: Line Segment Split
Premises : L on JM
Conclusions: JM = JL + LM

Step 4:
Theorem: Corresponding Angle Theorem
Premises : HS || KQ
Conclusions: ∠MHS = ∠MKQ, ∠MQK = ∠MSH

Step 5:
Theorem: Line Segment Split
Premises : P on MQ
Conclusions: MQ = MP + PQ

Step 6:
Theorem: Line Segment Split
Premises : L on KM
Conclusions: KM = KL + LM

Step 7:
Theorem: Corresponding Angle Theorem
Premises : HS || JR
Conclusions: ∠MHS = ∠MJR

Step 8:
Theorem: Corresponding Angle Theorem
Premises : JR || KQ
Conclusions: ∠MJR = ∠MKQ, ∠MQK = ∠MRJ

Step 9:
Theorem: Evaluate
Premises : 3 = MP, 6 = PQ
Conclusions: 9 = MP + PQ

Step 10:
Theorem: Line Segment Split
Premises : J on HM
Conclusions: HM = HJ + JM

Step 11:
Theorem: Line Segment Split
Premises : R on MS
Conclusions: MS = MR + RS

Step 12:
Theorem: Corresponding Angle Theorem
Premises : HS || LP
Conclusions: ∠MHS = ∠MLP

Step 13:
Theorem: Evaluate
Premises : 4 = KL, 2 = JK
Conclusions: 6 = JK + KL

Step 14:
Theorem: Corresponding Angle Theorem
Premises : JR || LP
Conclusions: ∠MPL = ∠MRJ, ∠MJR = ∠MLP

Step 15:
Theorem: Definition of Triangle
Premises : KQ, KM, MQ
Conclusions: △KMQ

Step 16:
Theorem: Corresponding Angle Theorem
Premises : KQ || LP
Conclusions: ∠MPL = ∠MQK

Step 17:
Theorem: Angle-Angle Similarity Theorem
Premises : ∠MJR = ∠MKQ, ∠MQK = ∠MRJ
Conclusions: △JMR ~ △KMQ

Step 18:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠MQK = ∠MSH, ∠MQK = ∠MRJ
Conclusions: ∠MRJ = ∠MSH

Step 19:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 9 = MP + PQ, MQ = MP + PQ
Conclusions: 9 = MQ

Step 20:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠MHS = ∠MLP, ∠MHS = ∠MKQ
Conclusions: ∠MKQ = ∠MLP

Step 21:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 6 = JK + KL, JL = JK + KL
Conclusions: 6 = JL

Step 22:
Theorem: Angle-Angle Similarity Theorem
Premises : ∠MPL = ∠MRJ, ∠MJR = ∠MLP
Conclusions: △JMR ~ △LMP

Step 23:
Theorem: Perimeter Definition
Premises : △KMQ
Conclusions: Perimeter(△KMQ) = KM + KQ + MQ

Step 24:
Theorem: Similar Definition
Premises : △JMR ~ △KMQ
Conclusions: ∠MJR = ∠MKQ, sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_k_m_q = MR / MQ, MR / MQ = Perimeter(△JMR) / Perimeter(△KMQ)

Step 25:
Theorem: Angle-Angle Similarity Theorem
Premises : ∠MRJ = ∠MSH, ∠MHS = ∠MJR
Conclusions: △HMS ~ △JMR

Step 26:
Theorem: Angle-Angle Similarity Theorem
Premises : ∠MPL = ∠MQK, ∠MKQ = ∠MLP
Conclusions: △KMQ ~ △LMP

Step 27:
Theorem: Similar Definition
Premises : △JMR ~ △LMP
Conclusions: MR / MP = Perimeter(△JMR) / Perimeter(△LMP), JM / LM = MR / MP, ∠MJR = ∠MLP, JR / LP = MR / MP

Step 28:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_k_m_q = MR / MQ, 9 = MQ
Conclusions: sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_k_m_q = MR / 9

Step 29:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 9 = MQ, MR / MQ = Perimeter(△JMR) / Perimeter(△KMQ)
Conclusions: MR / 9 = Perimeter(△JMR) / Perimeter(△KMQ)

Step 30:
Theorem: Similar Definition
Premises : △HMS ~ △JMR
Conclusions: sim_ratio_triangle_h_m_s_triangle_j_m_r = HM / JM, sim_ratio_triangle_h_m_s_triangle_j_m_r = MS / MR, ∠MHS = ∠MJR

Step 31:
Theorem: Similar Definition
Premises : △KMQ ~ △LMP
Conclusions: ∠MPL = ∠MQK, sim_ratio_triangle_k_m_q_triangle_l_m_p = KQ / LP, KM / LM = MQ / MP, MQ / MP = Perimeter(△KMQ) / Perimeter(△LMP), sim_ratio_triangle_k_m_q_triangle_l_m_p = MQ / MP

Step 32:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : MR / MP = Perimeter(△JMR) / Perimeter(△LMP), 3 = MP
Conclusions: MR / 3 = Perimeter(△JMR) / Perimeter(△LMP)

Step 33:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 3 = MP, JM / LM = MR / MP
Conclusions: MR / 3 = JM / LM

Step 34:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 2 = LP, 3 = MP, JR / LP = MR / MP
Conclusions: JR / 2 = MR / 3

Step 35:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_k_m_q = MR / 9
Conclusions: 9 * sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_k_m_q = MR

Step 36:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : sim_ratio_triangle_k_m_q_triangle_l_m_p = KQ / LP, 2 = LP
Conclusions: sim_ratio_triangle_k_m_q_triangle_l_m_p = KQ / 2

Step 37:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 9 = MQ, 3 = MP, KM / LM = MQ / MP
Conclusions: 9 / 3 = KM / LM

Step 38:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : MQ / MP = Perimeter(△KMQ) / Perimeter(△LMP), 9 = MQ, 3 = MP
Conclusions: 9 / 3 = Perimeter(△KMQ) / Perimeter(△LMP)

Step 39:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : sim_ratio_triangle_k_m_q_triangle_l_m_p = MQ / MP, 9 = MQ, 3 = MP
Conclusions: 9 / 3 = sim_ratio_triangle_k_m_q_triangle_l_m_p

Step 40:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : 6 = JL, KM = KL + LM, 4 = KL, 9 / 3 = KM / LM, JM = JL + LM
Conclusions: 8 = JM

Step 41:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : KM = KL + LM, 4 = KL, 9 / 3 = KM / LM
Conclusions: 2 = LM

Step 42:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 9 / 3 = sim_ratio_triangle_k_m_q_triangle_l_m_p, sim_ratio_triangle_k_m_q_triangle_l_m_p = KQ / 2
Conclusions: 9 / 3 = KQ / 2

Step 43:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : MR / 3 = JM / LM, 8 = JM, 9 * sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_k_m_q = MR, 2 = LM
Conclusions: 8 / 2 = (9 * sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_k_m_q) / 3

Step 44:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : 9 / 3 = Perimeter(△KMQ) / Perimeter(△LMP), 9 = MQ, 9 / 3 = KQ / 2, KM = KL + LM, 4 = KL, 9 / 3 = KM / LM, Perimeter(△KMQ) = KM + KQ + MQ
Conclusions: 7 = Perimeter(△LMP)

Step 45:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : 9 = MQ, 9 / 3 = KQ / 2, KM = KL + LM, 4 = KL, 9 / 3 = KM / LM, Perimeter(△KMQ) = KM + KQ + MQ
Conclusions: 21 = Perimeter(△KMQ)

Step 46:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 7 = Perimeter(△LMP), MR / 3 = Perimeter(△JMR) / Perimeter(△LMP), 9 * sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_k_m_q = MR
Conclusions: (9 * sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_k_m_q) / 3 = Perimeter(△JMR) / 7

Step 47:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 21 = Perimeter(△KMQ), MR / 9 = Perimeter(△JMR) / Perimeter(△KMQ), 9 * sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_k_m_q = MR
Conclusions: (9 * sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_k_m_q) / 9 = Perimeter(△JMR) / 21

Step 48:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : (9 * sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_k_m_q) / 3 = Perimeter(△JMR) / 7, 8 / 2 = (9 * sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_k_m_q) / 3
Conclusions: 8 / 2 = Perimeter(△JMR) / 7

Step 49:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : 8 / 2 = Perimeter(△JMR) / 7, 9 * sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_k_m_q = MR, 6 = RS, (9 * sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_k_m_q) / 9 = Perimeter(△JMR) / 21, MS = MR + RS
Conclusions: 18 = MS

Step 50:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : 8 / 2 = Perimeter(△JMR) / 7, (9 * sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_k_m_q) / 9 = Perimeter(△JMR) / 21, 9 * sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_k_m_q = MR
Conclusions: 12 = MR

Step 51:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : 9 * sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_k_m_q = MR, 8 / 2 = Perimeter(△JMR) / 7, (9 * sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_k_m_q) / 9 = Perimeter(△JMR) / 21, JR / 2 = MR / 3
Conclusions: 8 = JR

Step 52:
Theorem: Evaluate
Premises : 12 = MR, 18 = MS
Conclusions: 1.5 = MS / MR

Step 53:
Theorem: Evaluate
Premises : 8 = JM, 8 = JR, 12 = MR
Conclusions: 14 = (JM + JR + MR) / 2

Step 54:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 8 = JM, 8 = JR
Conclusions: JM = JR

Step 55:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : sim_ratio_triangle_h_m_s_triangle_j_m_r = MS / MR, 1.5 = MS / MR
Conclusions: 1.5 = sim_ratio_triangle_h_m_s_triangle_j_m_r

Step 56:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 1.5 = sim_ratio_triangle_h_m_s_triangle_j_m_r, sim_ratio_triangle_h_m_s_triangle_j_m_r = HM / JM
Conclusions: 1.5 = HM / JM

Step 57:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : JM = JR, 1.5 = HM / JM, 14 = (JM + JR + MR) / 2, JR / 2 = MR / 3, HM = HJ + JM
Conclusions: 4 = HJ
